mappedQuestions.reasoning: Question asks to identify a specific example of a Tier 2 intervention (small-group social skills) within a multi-tiered framework.
Question asks for the definition of Response to Intervention (RTI) as a multi-tiered system for providing increasingly intensive interventions.
Question tests the fundamental principle of positive behavior support (changing the environment and teaching new skills vs. punishment).
Question asks for the main goal of the universal (Tier 1) level of PBIS (teaching expectations and acknowledging desired behaviors).
Question asks for a commonly used outcome variable for PBIS effectiveness (Office Discipline Referrals/ODRs).
Question asks to identify a Tier 1 intervention from a list (school-wide assembly vs. individual counseling).
Question asks for the three main components of school climate according to NASP (Engagement, Safety, Environment).
Question asks for the most useful metric for evaluating PBIS effectiveness (ODRs and suspensions), similar to Q083 but focused on evaluation.
Question tests the distinction between Tier 1 (all students) and Tier 2 (targeted group) supports.
Question asks for factors used to assess school climate (Physical, Social, and Emotional environments).
Question asks for the best sign of successful Tier 1 PBIS implementation (consistent teaching strategies and metrics) which relates to fidelity.

suggestedNewSkills.name: School Climate Components
suggestedNewSkills.description: Identify the core domains of school climate (Engagement, Safety, Environment) and the factors that contribute to them.
suggestedNewSkills.decisionRule: Correct answer identifies 'Engagement, Safety, Environment' or specific physical/social/emotional factors.
